text.tspan: so we don’t have to guess or try to
fix your issue (unless you ask for it).
Is what you need in this moment:
and imagine what it’s like to be you.
Speak to convey pertinent info about your
. Avoid random details to fill in awkward
gaps in the conversation. Rich conversations
not on the behalf of others.
. This may take a few rounds. A
good back and forth conversation is like a jour
nalistic inquiry and helps clarify what you need.
As you continue talking, you may change your
or do you just need me to listen right now?”
during silent gaps. Observe body language.
“Why do you think this is bothering you now?”
“It makes sense you’d feel like that.”
“We’ve all been there.” or “Deal with it.”
The mission of Tiny Talk gatherings is to expand circles of empathy by connecting diverse communities.
It’s deceptively simple, but takes practice. It all starts with learning how to share and how to listen.
